description: Catalog of known misconceptions for Assignment 2 (Q1-Q4) used for seeded validation

misconceptions.name: Using int instead of double for decimal values
misconceptions.description: Student declares variables as int when they should be double, causing loss of decimal precision

misconceptions.name: Integer division truncation
misconceptions.description: Student performs division with two integers, not realizing result is truncated (5/2 = 2, not 2.5)

misconceptions.name: Type mismatch in Scanner input
misconceptions.description: Student uses nextInt() when nextDouble() is needed, or vice versa

misconceptions.name: Incorrect operator precedence
misconceptions.description: Student doesn't use parentheses correctly, leading to wrong order of operations
misconceptions.example_incorrect: double a = v1 - v0 / t;  // divides v0 by t first
misconceptions.example_correct: double a = (v1 - v0) / t;  // subtracts first, then divides

misconceptions.name: Wrong formula - addition instead of subtraction
misconceptions.description: Student uses wrong arithmetic operator in formula (e.g., v1+v0 instead of v1-v0)

misconceptions.name: Incorrect formula derivation for fuel cost
misconceptions.description: Student uses wrong formula for computing fuel cost (e.g., multiplies instead of divides)

misconceptions.name: Missing intermediate variable for semi-perimeter
misconceptions.description: Student doesn't compute semi-perimeter s separately, tries to inline everything incorrectly
misconceptions.example_incorrect: double area = Math.sqrt((side1+side2+side3)/2 * ...);  // s used inline incorrectly
misconceptions.example_correct:
double s = (side1 + side2 + side3) / 2;
double area = Math.sqrt(s * (s-side1) * (s-side2) * (s-side3));

misconceptions.name: Using ^ instead of Math.pow() for exponentiation
misconceptions.description: Student uses ^ operator (XOR in Java) instead of Math.pow() for squaring
misconceptions.example_incorrect: double diff = (x2 - x1) ^ 2;  // XOR, not power!

misconceptions.name: Missing Math.sqrt() for square root
misconceptions.description: Student forgets to use Math.sqrt() or doesn't know how to compute square root

misconceptions.name: Incorrect Math.pow() argument order
misconceptions.description: Student swaps base and exponent in Math.pow(base, exponent)
misconceptions.example_incorrect: double square = Math.pow(2, x2 - x1);  // 2^(x2-x1) instead of (x2-x1)^2

misconceptions.name: Missing Scanner import
misconceptions.example_incorrect:
// No import statement
Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);

misconceptions.name: Scanner not reading correct number of inputs
misconceptions.description: Student reads wrong number of values (e.g., 2 instead of 3 for Q1)

misconceptions.name: Not closing Scanner resource
misconceptions.description: Student doesn't close Scanner, causing resource leak

misconceptions.name: Computing wrong quantity (different problem)
misconceptions.description: Student solves a completely different problem than what was asked
misconceptions.example_incorrect:
// Q1 asks for acceleration, student computes velocity
double v = v0 + a * t;
misconceptions.example_correct:
// Q1: compute acceleration
double a = (v1 - v0) / t;

misconceptions.name: Hardcoded values instead of user input
misconceptions.description: Student hardcodes values instead of reading from user input
